appearance.name: Openbox
appearance.description: Openbox is a highly configurable window manager. It is known for its minimalistic appearance and its flexibility. It is the most lightweight graphical option offered by RebornOS. Please Note: Openbox is not recommended for users who are new to Linux.

appearance.name: i3
appearance.description: i3 is a tiling window manager, completely written from scratch. i3 is primarily targeted at advanced users and developers. Target platforms are GNU/Linux and BSD operating systems

appearance.name: Budgie
appearance.description: Budgie is the flagship desktop of Solus and is a Solus project. It focuses on simplicity and elegance. Written from scratch with integration in mind, the Budgie desktop tightly integrates with the GNOME stack, but offers an alternative desktop experience.

appearance.name: Cinnamon
appearance.description: Cinnamon is a Linux desktop which provides advanced, innovative features and a traditional desktop user experience. Cinnamon aims to make users feel at home by providing them with an easy-to-use and comfortable desktop experience.

appearance.name: Deepin
appearance.description: IMPORTANT: Keep in mind that the Deepin desktop can often be unstable. This does not depend on us, but on the developers of Deepin who usually upload BETA versions of the desktop or some components in the stable repositories of Arch Linux.

appearance.name: Enlightenment
appearance.description: Enlightenment is not just a window manager for Linux/X11 and others, but also a whole suite of libraries to help you create beautiful user interfaces with much less work\n

appearance.name: GNOME
appearance.description: GNOME is an easy and elegant way to use your computer. It features the Activities Overview which is an easy way to access all your basic tasks.

appearance.name: KDE Plasma
appearance.description: If you are looking for a familiar working environment, KDE's Plasma Desktop offers all the tools required for a modern desktop computing experience so you can be productive right from the start.

appearance.name: LXQt
appearance.description: LXQt is the next-generation of LXDE, the Lightweight Desktop Environment. It is lightweight, modular, blazing-fast, and user-friendly.

appearance.name: MATE
appearance.description: MATE is an intuitive, attractive, and lightweight desktop environment which provides a more traditional desktop experience. Accelerated compositing is supported, but not required to run MATE making it suitable for lower-end hardware.

appearance.name: XFCE
appearance.description: Xfce is a lightweight desktop environment. It aims to be fast and low on system resources, while remaining visually appealing and user friendly. It suitable for use on older computers and those with lower-end hardware specifications.

appearance.name: UKUI
appearance.description: UKUI is simple and intuitive interface adapted to the habit of users. Files category speed up file search. Favorite apps shortcut makes starting up application more convenient. User management makes a more concise and friendly interaction for system.

appearance.name: LXDE
appearance.description: LXDE, which stands for Lightweight X11 Desktop Environment, is a desktop environment which is lightweight and fast. It is designed to be user friendly and slim, while keeping the resource usage low. LXDE uses less RAM and less CPU while being a feature rich desktop environment.

dms.name: SDDM
dms.description: QML based X11 and Wayland display manager

dms.name: GDM
dms.description: GNOME Display manager and login screen

kernels.name: Linux
kernels.description: The default Arch Linux kernel and modules

kernels.name: Linux LTS
kernels.description: The LTS Linux kernel and modules

kernels.name: Linux Zen
kernels.description: The Linux ZEN kernel and modules

kernels.name: Linux Hardened
kernels.description: The Security-Hardened Linux kernel and modules

packages.description: Kingsoft Office (WPS Office) - an office productivity suite

packages.name: Libre Office (Fresh)
packages.description: LibreOffice branch which contains new features and program enhancements

packages.name: Free Office
packages.description: A complete, reliable, lightning-fast and Microsoft Office-compatible office suite with a word processor, spreadsheet, and presentation graphics software

packages.name: Calligra
packages.description: A set of applications for productivity and creative usage

packages.name: Discord
packages.description: All-in-one voice and text chat for gamers that's free and secure

packages.name: Wine
packages.description: A compatibility layer for running Windows programs

packages.name: Brave
packages.description: Web browser that blocks ads and trackers by default

packages.name: Chromium
packages.description: A web browser built for speed, simplicity, and security

packages.name: Google Chrome
packages.description: The popular and trusted web browser by Google (Stable Channel)

packages.name: VLC
packages.description: Multi-platform MPEG, VCD/DVD, and DivX player

packages.name: Code - OSS
packages.description: The Open Source build of Visual Studio Code (vscode) editor
